OymOI8axVrZuAu6QiKJPWQ.text: We've been wanting to try different Thai restaurants around the neighborhood and I've had this one bookmarked for awhile. We finally visited for our first time last week. Thai cuisine is a staple in our family of two...we eat out for it, we cook a lot of it...so we know what we like and how we like it. So of course, we ordered our two favorite dishes - pad see ew and yellow curry. 5/5 on both dishes I have to say. We were able to customize spice level and dietary restrictions. We were able to make the curry vegan and take out the fish sauce! Love how accommodating the chef and servers were! I didn't get a chance to ask about the buffet and whether or not it was veg friendly - but next time we come in for dinner, we'll be inquiring for sure.   Location was interesting. Right off a main road and in an odd shaped parking lot. Didn't stop people from coming in that's for sure. Food came out in a reasonable amount of time, probably only seemed prolonged because we were quite hungry.   Also, The spice level is no joke. I initially asked for 3/5 but our server suggested I get a 2. It was definitely more than enough. I probably could've went for a 1/5 to be quite honest. Happy that our server knew what she was feeding us!   We'll be back here pretty soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad see ew and yellow curry. Yuuuuuummy!

GnlusiTk_MMruRbWU52acw.text: Pretty good Thai food. It seems that Thai is hard to find in Phoenix but this place gets it fairly well on the mark.   The heat levels range from 1-5 and for once, a place that understands how to rate heat. Some places you can order level 80 heat of 100 and it's not even on the register. (I've never understood that). Here, though, level 5 is "Thai hot". (Thank you for that). (Secretly, you can ask for more than level 5 heat, but be prepared!). Lol.   Establishment clean and staff feet friendly.  Food quality is good and portions are large.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepper beef with level 4 heat.

HZvOOz3UmNvV1DYQIuWYrQ.text: Holy crap this is amazing. The lunch buffet is crazy cheap for how many options of unlimited food you can eat. Such good curries and noodles. I wish they had the buffet for dinner since I am typically at work M-F during the buffet hours. I would take a day off work just to come here for lunch, it's worth it.

kD0fVoENFGn-g0lra5G5LA.text: This is my husband and I's favorite Thai restaurant in the valley. We used to go to Krua Thai on 16th street and Bell, but their customer service is horrible. So happy we found a better place. Not only is everything flavor wise at Reign of Thai on point, their customer service is great as well. The owner is super friendly! If you love spicy ethnic food, you'll love this place. THE SPICE LEVEL IS NO JOKE (which I love). It's not comparable to many locations, so if you can't handle spicy food and you're trying this place out for the first time, go but stick to getting a level 1 please, and don't ruin it for everyone else.

x8cnOWZp7E1gnWBYoSs9Gg.text: Great service! Very nice and everything on the menu is delicious! Its a little hard to find, but maybe hats what makes this such a gem!

DEgGe0TQLkZJH7CyJHPLyw.text: This place is the best Thai food in all of Arizona, yes, I said "ALL". It's a small family oriented establishment That's off of the freeway. As soon as you're sat down at a table a waiter greets you and he gives you his honest opinion  about what's his favorite dishes to eat. Everyone here including his son is super sweet and friendly. Their food has your mouth watering after each bite! I kid you not, you might leave this place crying. They have spices that start from a 1-5being the spiciest. I recommend you get a 3 because the 4 will have you sweating so I'm pretty sure the 5 will make you cry. This place is truly amazing

va6EKeAimN5-DvBJvXYWog.text: The best Thai I have ever hands down!    I live in a state away in New Mexico and there have been times my hubby and I have made the 7 to 8 hour drive just to eat here.

8I1EUQTs69eQn9gYo7XLZw.text: This was so enjoyable to check out.  We went for the lunch buffet so we could try the different variety of flavors.  We needed the education.  It was a great experience. There were several selections, fresh and hot.  Broaden your tastes and try them out.  Staff was attentive and checked the buffet continually keeping it refreshed and clean.   We'll be back.

E0LW2UizSxdnSm6zKBnJsQ.text: I am super into Thai food and I'm always looking for a good place to try, I had bookmarked Reign of Thai a while ago and was super excited to try it this past week. Location seems a little obscure, but that's not an issue haha.  So it wasn't too busy when I first was seated but it picked up pretty quick right after and there was just one server working there. He was doing a great job keeping up with the crowd though! Was always on the move, but still provided us great service. I usually go for red curry with tofu but I ended up getting masaman curry with tofu. It was very tasty and I liked it! The onions in it were nice and sweet. Peanuts added a nice crunch too. I think I would've liked the red curry a little better though. My experience was good, but I felt bad because my boyfriend did not have the same. He enjoyed his food (coconut soup), but ended up feeling very sick from it for the rest of the night :(.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Masaman curry with tofu

sNel5E5J-WroTHwmgXRlbQ.text: Everything had amazing flavor and the staff was very friendly. They cook spicer than normal. Two is fairly spicy.

rKRtEKB_w8Zeg_6_QE5UAg.text: Me and my husband came here since I read on Yelp that they have buffet for lunch time. And because I was craving for Thai food so much lol. The restaurant located in Cave Creek, which is a little far from our house.   Food: They have many signatures dishes which is really good, but limited. They have tom kha soup, yellow curry, wonton that I recommend is a must try. However, the pad thai with me is a little bland.   Price: $11.99 I believe so. Overall, it's a reasonable price.  Service: Nice and friendly, no complaints since I'm a picky person with people's attitudes lol  We will most likely return since me and my husband really enjoyed the food here.

oDd36917pzvzOO3jEfLUEw.text: Probably one of the nicest Thai restaurants I've enjoyed... certainly in this part of town.  Have always enjoyed the lunch buffet and dined with friends for dinner several times always a lovely meal. Thanks

TBLcQYILp9EmmOWVO7G7Ew.text: Best Thai food in Arizona hands down.  Service is amazing and everything is made from scratch.  Yellow Curry, Drunken Noodles, and crab puffs highly recommended. Everything is spiced to perfection.  Stop looking at other restaurants just go.

kHNq9xcMNOI_dnzwPQGNXQ.text: Yay!!! What a pleasant surprise to find this place is so close to where we livethis is a lovely little gem! And the food is so good, fresh and clean!!  Reputation for spicy so order it mild because It will still be a little spicy

K1kzPG5hEnEGTr-2X0L5UA.text: Amazing Thai spot. I was hooked the first time i came, and came back 3 other times because i was so excited to show each friend this place! The greatest part is this location is walking distance from my house. At first, the place looked a little iffy on the outside, but on the inside it's very nice, cute, and the food is amazing! I love the glasses they use for water and the fish shaped dishes they use for the pad thai plates. I ordered the tofu coconut soup, shrimp pad Thai, and Thai tea. I recommend trying all of them!

9e7uCFljTagp9tWXNtmtiw.text: Just visited this excellent establishment, the food was delicious. My husband and I tried the fried rice, pad thai, teriyaki beef and egg rolls. I enjoyed every extremely hot bite of it. The advice of others is accurate, easy on the spice scale. I had a 2 and oiy.  The place is clean and has a neat little paint job on the outside. Don't blink or you might miss it. I highly recommend you give er a try.

hZOaophg5x3wO5FmPrYixQ.text: This place is TERRIBLE! I hadn't been there in 4 years, but a friend suggested we meet there so I thought I would give it another try. Unfortunately, nothing had changed. It took 50 minutes to get our food! This is status quo. No apologies, no server checking on us to say food was coming, no server asking us if we wanted more drinks. The service SUCKED! They do have a sign under their glass table top somewhat warning you that their kitchen is small but their food is good. Sorry, it's not worth a 50 minute wait. There are much better Thai restaurants out there. Go somewhere else!

ggQJCHQ0hMGBS4IhUE9T9Q.text: I ordered a noodle dish at medium spice level which is something I normally do at any Thai restaurant.  The spice level was so high I couldn't taste the flavor of the food and enjoy it.  When I said something to the waiter, he laughed and said their medium is a 1 on a scale of 1-5.  Would've been nice to know before ordering.  If a 1 is medium spice level, then there must not be a mild option?!  Won't go here again.  Besides the lack of being able to taste my food, I waited a long time for a drink refill of iced tea which they do limit the number of refills for iced tea (silly and ridiculous).

WSrkCyLqPoTSJyBvLrasRQ.text: If you're looking for really good Thai food, this is the answer .. Love discovering hole in the wall places!! Here's what we tried: fish cakes, tom ka soup, Thai basil chicken, pad thai, pad see eww.  First trip and we are hooked! Already planning on coming back to try their buffet on Sunday. 18 delicious choices..wow! Best of all, the owner and staff are simply amazing people.

i-Ragec7iJ-b5qkp8fQEow.text: Awesome place with a nice atmosphere and friendly service. I got the yellow curry super spicy, and it was delicious. It was served very hot though, and it took a while to cool to a point where I could actually eat it. I also got the Thai tea, which was delicious - very similar to chai tea. I plan on returning to try the $10.99 lunch buffet!

71Dx4KbHbeOqtoOd3lpfGQ.text: The best Thai food I've had in Phoenix... Well really the best I've ever had anywhere ever. Pad thai- amazing, panang curry- holy sh*t, fried tofu -yes please!   This place is formally Pete's Thai. The new staff here is really friendly and seem really happy to have you dining at their restaurant.  The food presentation is perfect... The vegetables still are colorful and not over cooked. The waitress knew what was gluten free - which was basically everything on the menu. Oh and the plates they use are adorable. Hand painted white and blue china.   Pretty much every aspect was perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gmsfht_GfJTu2TJ8Bk0mFQ.text: This place is a True gem, even though it's in the middle of nowhere Phoenix.  Great family owned service, tasty spices in every dish, very cute/quaint setting and affordable menus.  Definitely one of the best Thai restaurants we've tried in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Thai art within the restaurant.

qHIgkIaDs66LkgK4UBmGoA.text: This is an amazing Thai restaurant.  The staff is great and the food is absolutely wonderful. It's spicy the way I like it and a great variety of dishes are on the menu. I recommend the red chicken curry and Thai toast. There is also a great lunch buffet which is also a favorite time of mine to go. This is a must go to place if you're looking for great food, great service, and great atmosphere.

g0QU4MhPlY8kV60oPtfTeg.text: We had dinner here last night and I have never had Thai, so needless to say I was hesitant.  We had Thai Egg Rolls, Coconut Soup, Steamed Mussell Soup, Larb Chopped Salad, Stir-Fried Egg Plant, a couple of other dishes, can you say INCREDIBLE!!! Well there were 7 of us and very little went home with us.  The waiter we had was a little jittery only because it was his first night, he did a fantastic job.  Looking for a healthy, delicious, enjoyable experience, this is the place to go.  Bring your family, friends, any one who likes something new and different.  You can't go wrong!!

v03UIRisqZdx563EpQjfDg.text: Very good and authentic. Very much worth it if your looking for really great Tai food.

_cXuJUM8pPfy5wy03TIK-A.text: Ate for dinner - food was okay with very big portions.  For spicy level I normally order 4 or 5 at Thai restaurants, but we played it safe and did 2 since my wife prefers it more mild.  WARNING - the food was waaaay spicier than 2 and the wife couldn't eat more than a couple bites.  It even had me sweating a little - I made a comment to the waiter and he proudly told me they use fresh ground peppers and their 3 was a 5 at other places.  That's great and all - but a little up front warning would be nice since we did say we wanted to keep it mild.  For dishes, we had pad Thai and green pineapple curry.  Quality was good and the curry made for great leftovers.  Still, I felt the food overall was average and didn't come close to unseating Siam as my favorite Thai food in the valley - I suppose I'd give 3.5 stars if I could.

PEOKzlm0VQPXG7W-98ZUsw.text: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix. They know how to make things hot. I order a 2  on a 1 to 5 scale there.  Other Thai restaurants I order a #4.  The food comes out fast.   Great service.  Family owned with a lunch buffet too.

59P-vmsA5pD6n9WmLEIXtw.text: Let's start with the soups. Out of this world delicious. The Silver Noodle and Tom Kha are spectacular. Deeply flavorful. Hands down some of the best soups I've had in a long time. Clearly I can't recommend Reign of Thai's soups more.   On to the noodles. The Pad Thai is always a good point of comparison, and sadly, Reign of Thai's Pad Thai was a major swing and a miss. It was waaaay too sweet, lacked any kind of complex flavor, and even my kid said it was gross and wouldn't eat it. Yuck.   The Pad See Ew was ok, but nothing special. It was edible, at least.   Larb is one of our very favorite dishes and sadly, this white girl makes a far better larb in her own kitchen. It majorly lacked one of the signature flavors of larb: toasted rice powder. It's like they skimped on it. Not cool.   They also really skimped on the service. Awful. Just awful. Aside from actually carrying our dishes to our table, there was literally no service. He never checked on us which made it difficult to ask where our missing dish was. It also left us very thirsty.  All in all, Reign of Thai offered a good soup experience and I'd come back for those. But only those. Otherwise, it's not worth the trip if you're looking for an authentic, high quality Thai meal.

bS6q2F73GcilNqcZO_k4Kw.text: We are from Sedona and once a month we go down to Phoenix to spend the day.  We looked up this restaurant online and we like the reviews we saw. We tried out for ourselves and we absolutely loved this place.  Thai food is one of my favorites and I have been too many Thai restaurants before in Chicago,  Southern California and Sedona, but I must say that Reign of thai is the best one among them.  We arrived right when they started their buffet , 11:30am, and the place was sort of empty. By the time we left, the place was packed.  We tried the pad tai, chicken Panang, spicy basil chicken, the vegetable rolls and the coconut soup and everything tasted so good.  We also ordered fresh shrimp rolls because my wife loves them.  The staff is super friendly and professional.  The place is very clean, and well organized. I recommend this place to anyone that loves Thai food.  My wife and I are definitely coming back here... Well done Reign of Thai !!!

ubHW6Lchv_gZzh8_6RhRRA.text: My roommate and I have gone to this little family own restaurant for quite while, but I have kept feeling guilty not to write a review here for supporting it. We found this nice restaurant on Yelp also. The service is always great because all the servers are helping each other on every table. Sometimes the server A may come to ask you if you need more drinks or anything else. No matter you say yes or no. After the server A left, the server B or C might come over to ask you the same questions again. This is not because the servers aren't communicating with each other, this is showing each of them isn't just care about his or her own table and tips! This what we called the team work to make the service better than others. Let's talk about the food. I only have tried a few dishes so far because I stick with the same certain dishes when I like them. The dish that I usually order is the fresh rolls with shrimp and tofu for appetizer and the fresh ginger with chicken for main entree. They are both yummy! The price isn't too bad at all.  The only thing that we need to get use to is they close in the afternoon for few hours and reopen at 5PM. If you would like to check out their food. You will need to check on their opening hours first.

x5ymMWUyTG6xl2vcEpoV3g.text: I can not begin to explain how great this place is!!! I love the yellow curry, it's a must try!!! The lunch buffet is also a must, such a great deal with lots of great choices! I seriously try to come here once a week!

pB5qcg9JtqqagjpFPBsR2w.text: We thought there wasn't any good Thai restaurants in Phoenix after living here for 5 years. Our neighbor told us about Reign of Thai.  Absolutely fantastic!  A must try.

KERkWowmvItaxWNYrDfeHQ.text: This place is amazing!!! I get take out and it's always super hot and fresh! I love the red curry with chicken I've had other things on the menu as well and it is all top notch!

smntvAC_loPoCPil9Zkc_Q.text: Simply delicious. We went there a few times and always fresh and perfect. I had a silky and aromatic  Tom ka Gai soup with coconut milk and mushrooms and bamboo shots that brought more zesty flavors to the note of heart;)) I love Thai cuisine a lot!!:)))))

6xrkFuYAyKRfydfpjl4sSA.text: The locality might scare off some people. But one finds diamonds in coal mines and gold in river dirt. Amazing food. Loved every bite of it. The pad thai was amazing. So was the sa-tay. Would definitely recommend to other people.

s86Ev0k6rwfOvttyuae4Bg.text: Great find! Our server Sean was very friendly and attentive. We ordered spicy basil with shrimp and massaman curry with pork. Both dishes were very good. Sean asked if we have been there before. Since it was our first time he explained that their food is spicier than others. I am so grateful he told us. I went with level one hot and it was perfect. I enjoy spice but I enjoy flavor even more. Since it's about a 40 minute ride for us I am wishing they were closer. I do find the Thai restaurants here are more pricey than back in Illinois. I sure miss Thai Smile back in IL.

LwoZGcpGqkQpHWNYYBZG2Q.text: Service is always good here and the food is super tasty. I come here often with my friend when they serve lunch buffets. Today I stopped in 10 mins after they stopped serving their lunch buffet and got something from their regular menu. My friend and I were the only customers and the only reason Im giving them 2 stars is because they (all three servers) acted like we weren't there. They were talking so loud while they were cleaning up the tables and we felt that it was very rude to do it while we were there. Those kind of conversations can be discussed in the back or when there is no one at the restaurant.

wivpyzg9JRLdMbtRJnbb0g.text: Good buffet! We ate way too much! Great noodles and soup and eggplant. Curry was a bit bland but not horrible. If we are in the area again, will be back. Yum yum

0pKldLZsl8UiX38DGSh34Q.text: This place is AMAZING. Whether you do the lunch buffet or order by plate, you'll love what you get. No matter what though, you must try the mango with sticky rice. It's perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z1VAqMIjIS9YaoKzdFoT7w.text: By far one of my favorite places to eat in Phoenix. I have never had a single complaint and we have been here a countless number of times.   The staff is friendly and professional. They are always welcoming and provide awesome service. They really take pride in their work and are a big reason why we will keep coming back.  Their food is phenomenal! Fresh ingredients, large portions, distinct and flavorful sauces, and SPICE. We always ask for our food to be "thai hot" and most places hardly ever give us anything hotter than a 2 or 3. Reign of thai gives you exactly what you ask for, every time. If you can't handle spicy food don't ask for anything higher than a 1 or 2 here.   During their lunch hours they do a buffet. This allowed us to try a variety of the different dishes they have to offer, including their spicy eggplant dish which has become a personal favorite of mine. Another great thing about the buffet is they allow you to take it to-go by charging by the pound. Try not to go too late (right before they close for the afternoon). They are sometimes out of certain dishes by this point, which is to be expected.   We've ordered food to-go here several times as well. We're never left waiting very long for the food to be cooked and it comes out just the way we ordered it each time.  If you are ever looking for a place to eat great thai food in Phoenix don't miss the opportunity to try Reign of Thai. You won't be disappointed.

WfMKQ-MRXc5ZCYzR3SqK7g.text: This was my fiance's and my favorite Thai place. We used to order here all the time and dine in when we lived in the area. We have since moved about 20 minutes away and the last two times we came to order take out the food was so unbelievably spicy that we weren't able to eat it. It's beyond frustrating when a place you've eaten at for over a year suddenly makes a level 1 dish so spicy that it ends up in the trash can. We've wasted over $100 in two trips at this point and I can't justify trying it again. So frustrating. I just don't see what the point in making the lowest spice level on the scale something that is inedible to somebody who can tolerate a little heat.

46YoK5B4hTUx7rr-cXP2Ig.text: My wife and daughter are super picky so I don't always trust their recommendations on food; however, they were eating in this restaurant yesterday  and said how good it was and that they were going to bring me some takeout. OMG sometimes you stroll upon an absolute gem. Even though the takeout was cold I had reheated it was absolutely outstanding. I had pad Thai and Thai roles.  I can't say enough about the flavor profiles and how  absolutely delicious iit was. There he level between one and five. I was told that it is a very hot scale and to be conservative so I ordered  1.5. It was plenty hot. Absolute shame that this place is all the way across town from me.

5iPmF2ivqqP8koISe3p8ng.text: the coconut soup was most excellent .. great small establishment here on corner of Cave Creek/Thunderbird Rd.  They have fresh (delish) food, friendly staff, and great prices (buffet) .. check this place out.

6RAhFvEr0yFmFDXi9rsB7g.text: Best Thai in town! We have been getting takeout for quite sometime and it always is amazing!

NIXSB6o2OtZaeOfM2aO6Vw.text: If you are a fan of Thai food or like food with a spicy hot kick, you need to try Reign of Thai. First impressions when you walk through the door may be a bit off putting. The interior has a bit of an "unfinished" feel, but upon being seated at our table and having a look around it takes on a charm of its own. We started with Thai fish cakes that were flavorful with a nice cucumber salad on the side that added a welcome brightness. The food... A word of warning, specify your heat level, Thai food can get rediculously spicy hot! Our server asked us how hot we would like it and I'm a fan of a bit of brow sweat while not over powering heat, so I chose "medium heat" which amounts to a Thai heat level of level one! I had the Drunken Noodle with chicken and shrimp, no bell pepper. The flavor was spot on, absolutely wonderful. Four plump shrimp and a proper amount of chicken, making for a satisfying meal. l I almost had to take home leftovers, but it was so tasty I ended up eating it all with no room for dessert! (NOTE: I am compelled to mention an aside on meat portions of "Asian style foods" in general. I get tired of reading reviews that complain of not enough meat in their dishes. Sure, we love our 14+ ounce steaks, but where we eat meat as the main ingredient of a plate it is more of a garnish in Asian dishes due to costs and availability in other countries. Now back to the review!) My wife had the Spicy Green Bean with beef. Of course I had to have a taste, the aroma coming off the plate was alluring... Just a great flavored dish! We complimented our meals with a couple of Sapporo and I cannot wait to go back! The menu has something for everyone; vegetarian, fish, meat, rice, noodles... I want to try it all!

sJR3hkdTvepDQ3HYNKVLhg.text: Tried this little place tonight and we are so happy we did. I wanted spicy food and this place didn't disappoint. We got the coconut soup which was fantastic, level 2 hot was perfectly hot without being painful. Also, Panang curry with squid and the sticky rice with mango. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. Will definitely be back.

Fz-EFCVuD2qpgWMNAxZcSQ.text: Holy awesome!! Drive by this place twice a day to and from work and never noticed it! Did a Google for Thai and found it and some good reviews. This is by FAR the BEST Thai I have EVER had!! Staff is super friendly and multiple checked on us to make sure we were okay and that we had enough water. Cause you'll need it!! Very spicy. Did a level 1 and it was almost too much and I love spicy food!! The Tom yum lemongrass was the best I've ever had anywhere and the Spicy Noodles w/basil were excellent! Food takes a while because the kitchen is small but it is worth the wait! Can't say enough. Will be back at least weekly! Very reasonably priced and very good portions. LOVE it!

nvRxxyJ-vNyGLz5k5rsUAw.text: Love this place! Soup is one of the best Thai coconut tum yum I've ever had. Their noon buffet is to die for. They make small batches so it is always fresh. You may have to wait between batches but WELL worth the wait! Great variety and good heat level A spice tray is available if you care to ramp it up. I can't hardly eat anywhere else in the Phoenix area with out thinking "We should of gone to Reign of Thai." The staff and the chefs ROCK!

mGTdtEB_pVvkVFb2sYFaFQ.text: Probably the best thai food I had. When I ordered the server asked how hot I wanted my food,  so I said "thai hot" , he said that was about a 4 on a scale to 5. So I asked to get it as hot as possible.  He looked at me like I was crazy,  so I looked at him like he was crazy for thinking I couldn't the heat,  so I asked for a 10 on a scale of 1 to 5. The food was so hot I might as well have been eating the peppers,  but it was so good I couldn't stop eating.

eCd5KkCX9YxQI6LzxMGT4w.text: Been here a few times with my brother. The service is always top notch. They greet you as soon as you walk in the door. I usually get the same thing everytime, but food is good. Only drawback for me is the atmosphere.

ZfA6F7n0pShHvX14nCCSEQ.text: I had an awful experience at Reign of Thai. It started when I asked our waiter to tell me more about one of the dishes and he refused, saying that in all restaurants all waiters are always trained to say every single dish is the most amazing. The wait for our food was very long, and when my Pad See Ew finally came, the noodles were completely overlooked, the scrambled egg was burnt, and there was no sauce whatsoever. When I told the waiter this, he told me "this is how we make it here." (Another person at my table ordered the same thing and had both sauce and not burnt egg...) My husband had ordered an entree with beef that had maybe 1-2 ounces of actual meat in it, and the waiter's response to that was "we put in five ounces." Not "I'm sorry" or anything like that, merely a statement indicating that we were lying.  I have two stars because other people at or table had good food; my experience was definitely marred by the waiter's rudeness.

yxqwo-xipL44tTHdbjXxGQ.text: We've been here for the lunch buffet and it's pretty good food. The coconut soup and wantons are worth the price alone, but the rest of the buffet is pretty amazing. My only issue is the service. They're understaffed, and it shows during the lunch rush. I've had to get up and get my own water on more than one occasion, and ask repeatedly for something I've ordered from the menu. There's been a few times I've gone and they have had difficulty restocking their foods. The owner can have a bit of an attitude sometimes. The food is excellent, but the service is just meh.

6Vx-74MD_RuxaAzfvoUJPw.text: We went to this restaurant for the first time since new owners to go over a few years ago we didn't know they were new owners or we would've tried sooner but when I explain to the waitress that we were worried because I don't eat spicy at all and I was scared I wouldn't find anything on the buffet she went with me and showed me all the options and how spicy they were and it turned out absolutely awesome and I was thrilled to death with my food it was all very tasty and not spicy in the ones that she showed me my husband who like spicy he was thrilled to death with his which were all very spicy

q5qavZw6wp5ShQvX3Qsawg.text: This is my favorite Thai place in the valley. It's very quaint BUT they have a delicious buffet. All the food was very fresh and very reasonable. I can't wait to go back!

BnrYEwQhge12kl9IR546uQ.text: I seek spice and this place meets expectations! The level 5 spice is hot! If you like your Thai food spicy, this is your spot.

SMZCh0wD6j1dvhat1yWd6w.text: Amazing Thai food from a restaurant next to an auto shop. We came right at 5:15pm on a Saturday night. There were two other couples there but plenty of open tables.  First, the iced green tea and the Thai tea were delicious. Our food came out very quickly.  We had the spicy noodles and the red pineapple curry.  They were both great.  A word of caution: this place uses chilies that are spicier than most of the other Thai places in town. So I would suggest going down a number from what you would get from other restaurants.

Bz5wzTLKqBOfYuVx0wfs3g.text: Great food and very nice staff! We will be visiting this restaurant many times in the future. Idk what it is but I like the feel of this place too.

2UUAd0GqjcvqqoET8iTfhQ.text: I think I've been to nearly every thai restaurant in this deer Valley/ Glendale area and this spot is the one that just hit the mark on everything. Last time we had the Pad see ew and the Tom kha and I'd recommend both.

zmONlVkch-uy9ZIyEbptUw.text: Thai Buffet with friendly service.  Good place to eat when you don't know what to eat or just want to try variety of Thai food.  I tend to order the same food over and over again at Thai restaurant but since I wanted to try more different dishes, I came here to try.  I started with Thai tea, always good to have on standby just in case food is too hot. I went back three times to get different dishes and all were consistently good.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai tea

AM3jLMw0e3Be5jy3ZotGGw.text: In town for work and this place sounds great from reviews. I am a huge fan of Thai food so I order Raad Na and FBI- Fried Banana Ice Cream. The lady on the phone was fun and charismatic, tells me the order will be ready for pickup in 35 min. I show up after 40 min and it's not ready, ok I will wait.  30 more min pass..  not a full restuarant so unsure what's going on. I see my Raad Na is ready but the FBI is not- I cancel that part and the staff seem irritated, really? ...  I am wasting my night sitting here. I am hungry.  The Raad Na was not anything I have had before that would qualify as the name, it was still really good, just not what I wanted.  Bummer.

LJ-hzr6yTOt24lgdIR4GTg.text: Buffet is good but they have limited selection  and expecting more items on Sea food that includes fried rice too  chicken coconut soup and Thai tea are most recommended

6G9ni28Sx0ThFlnx2pEvAg.text: Hands down the best Thai food I've ever eaten. You may not expect it, because of the location, but this place is so tasty. We got the pan naeng, coconut soup (tom kha) and the Pad Thai. Id have to say that the coconut soup and the pad Thai were the real winners. The service was great and we ordered extra spicy food so she kept the water coming. Oh, the portions are pretty huge too! I will be back again and again.

61Es7Zyt-Fz44o7c8UzDGA.text: WOW such a great place for Thai food!  Wonderful. Friend suggested we come here and was definitely not disappointed. My friends and I shared a couple of dishes, and all were wonderful. Would definitely recommend their pad thai -- one of the best I've had to date. Green curry was also great as well!  Parking can be a little difficult because it is in such a small plaza.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pad see ew

ftz4PzfJCDgu_9Zkm4W8WQ.text: This is definitely my favorite Thai place. Best time to get there is right when it opens so that way you get your food quick. Everything is fresh. The pad Thai is super yummy, as well as the mengo and sticky rice! Definitely a yum yum place

idR1prXj3lPfpv2nP9N0oQ.text: Great Thai food! Everything I have ordered here has been very good. They also have a buffet on certain days and time. I unfortunately came late one time to their Buffet and they had ran out of some items that I really wanted. The selection also wasn't very large but again the food is very good and when we order outside of the buffet it is a great place for Thai food.

Qe9ciSGwc7g-PLq7j8_HFw.text: Just as many other reviewers had said, the food here was excellent. Very flavorful and delightful. Portions were generous. The servers were very sweet, efficient, friendly and helpful. Taking the advice of other reviewers, we asked for food with number one spice rating. I was eating with my father and both of us like mildly spicy food. We were quite surprised when a number one was actually pretty spicy... Really the upper limits of our tolerance. Therefore, we decided we would have gone for a point five instead of a one! So unless you like very very spicy, I would ask for a half a point! The atmosphere is basic... As other people said, casual. Not much to it. Otherwise I would have given them a five star rating. Regardless we will definitely be back... This was a happy find!

EJLiTg8jQ3r_6fjvjJ2_gg.text: HORRIBLE in every way. Overpriced,spoiled food and what wasn't spoiled is poor quality. Chicken wontons had ZERO chicken or anything in them. Tofu was rancid and the sweet and sour chicken tasted like cheap frozen par cooked chicken that had been sitting out all day then reheated. When we told them about the chicken the girl just rolled her eyes and walked away, then came back and took the food away, not even asking if we wanted something else. After telling them about the tofu in my curry a different girl told me it was supposed to taste that way. For anyone who eats tofu on a regular knows it isn't supposed to taste sour. We get our bill and they tried to charge for the food we didn't even eat! When I went to go pay for what our kids actually ate, the girl at the register tried to argue with me about it. If I had a choice to give 0 stars I would. This place needs to learn how to treat people and take a good look at the product they're ordering and how to prepare it properly if they ever want to be successful. Don't waste your time or money!

Y3_YacbrKTL05g0Vd7IZfQ.text: The food is always great! Love to be there for the buffet, but Saturday lunch is also great! Price is reasonable. The location is not close to phoenix, but quiet and cozy place to have great lunch with friends and family.

l77xaUbr4kermciGkM6HtA.text: We got a Big Fresh Pork & spicy noodles take out. They asks how spicy? 1-10? We said 2. We got it home, took one bite, and it was Too spicy to eat! My wife likes spicy, and it was Too spicy for her!. At this point it was to spicy to eat!! Will never go back. Was a of money! :-(

Lh0blpeSscIAvdb9Kt0vdw.text: So so so darn good. In the last month we have been 3 times and heading back tonight. The deep fried tofu with pad Thai is my absolute fav !  I have tried bites of other dishes and they were so good

7BzC3opivtVh9wNyScFk_g.text: Great authentic food and service but a little overpriced. The menu offers quite enough to find what you want. The fried shrimps are awesome, not greasy and the Pad Thai is simply delicious... The atmosphere is simple and warm. The only bad thing would be the fact they don't serve beer on tap but the food is truly what to come for...

NpgOgEh94fAOdfP4HKhHwA.text: Food is amazing... BUT... you HAVE to order out if you want to sample it. The service is very SLOW if you sit inside during busy time.  Took well over 45 minutes for soup and one entree and every other table around us had gotten their food, including soup first, even though they were sat well after us.  Going during a down time means you get your stuff very quick and equally delicious!!

uZ4OyHfo1J-4bVrW5K6Jeg.text: Warning up front, you will wait a long time for your food, so bring pleasant dinner companions and don't go there when already hangry. This little restaurant is hidden next to an automotive shop and you'd barely guess it was there if you weren't looking for it. It's cute inside and the waitstaff is nice and friendly.  We ordered the fried squid for an appetizer, the vegetable fried rice, and an eggplant dish with chicken and the green curry with squid. We ordered everything as a 3 on the heat scale except for the green curry-that we ordered in a 4.  The 4 will bring tears to your eyes while the 3 is perfect.  It will make you need to blow your nose a bit, but it's deliciously hot instead of murderous. The eggplant dish was amazing, the green curry was delicious!  I would say that I wasn't a huge fan of the fried squid OR the squid in the curry--too chewy for my taste.  But the flavors are there for sure.  After the amazing flavor of the two main dishes, the vegetable fried rice was slightly boring, but I don't think that's the fault of the fried rice-I think it's just that the main dishes were simply too good. I could easily eat here once a week forever and be happy.

H4kZwUWNt32YC9yKQr6UPA.text: The lunch buffet is the main reason I have come here in the past, as they have offered a good variety of well prepared dishes at a very good price. I have also come here for regular dinner, which in my experience was even better than the buffet; no surprise there, as that is the general trend in restaurants that offer lunch buffets. After a long hiatus from visiting this restaurant, I tried their  lunch buffets two more times and things have changed. The food is OK but not great, and the variety that was the big draw for me in the past was no longer there. The fried rice is still good, the pad thai (only one kind instead of two from my past visits) was on the bland side, and the remaining dishes were mostly just tofu and chicken - good proteins, definitely, but gone are the mussel and fish dishes that I had enjoyed in the past buffets. I would definitely come here again, but when I do, it will be for the regular (non-buffet) lunch or dinner. Service remains friendly and the buffet price is still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. From the lunch buffet.

hWoopnvHXa8wQopeyF9cdQ.text: I have tried most of the Thai food restaurants on the west valley and this place is number 1. They have the best flavor and it tastes fresh. I can't explain fully how much better this place is compared to most but they just have that touch.   Their Thai tea is more flavorful as well and you can sub the milk out for coconut milk which is amazing!  Try it out and see for yourself! Everything I have had there hasn't let me down.

6xy2dFlowauBoESRiFXQTw.text: We visited Reign of Thai on Sunday for lunch buffet. The restaurant seems popular yet not too crowded. There are a relatively large variety of choices, including several types of curry (from non-spicy to moderate spicy), seafood (like mussels and fish), main food (like pad thai, fried rice, wontons), and assorted veggies. They don't look very fancy, but are just tasty, which also gives you a hint of a real Thai flavor. Services are ok and kind of efficient. The only thing I would suggest is that the Thai tea is a little too sweet even with lots of ice. For $11.99 per person, it is really worth the money and the time you spend there with friends and family. Highly recommended.

vyWtwwNUUEqr5MS6bEIOGA.text: Walked in at 7:15 pm on a Friday as a party of two. We were seated promptly, but that was the last human contact. Three parties were seated and had drink and food orders taken while we sat.   Wasn't able to catch anyone's eye and our departure didn't stimulate any comment.  I was really disappointed, it looks like it might be good. The place wasn't overly busy, no line or anything. Not really sure what's going on....

3DbSrO6bxj-T5i3e-Oprwg.text: I come here for the lunch buffet and it is always fantastic. All staff are courteous and attentive. Love the coconut soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai chilis
Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed veggies , egg noodles and rice
Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yellow curry

NQ-qIrpJXJ0U_6tvbtW3vA.text: OMG!!!! this is one of the most AWESOME buffett that I have been to and the only Thai one EVER IN MY LIFE!!!   Start with the size: deceptive of how big it is from the outside. I was thinking a small place but inside is a full bar and atleast 12-15 four person tables and 2 sets of 8 person tables.   The buffett: homemade taste and heartfilled energy that goes with it. 16 dishes to try from pad thai to currys( red green yellow) tofu diahes too. 2 soups today is coconut chicken with HUGE mushrooms killee flavor but not overpowering heat. The Tam Yum is amazing the base of that soup per my spouse is a sweet carrot tase with the Tam Yum flavor. She said it makes her feel like a little kid and makes her tummy feels good. The steamed rice is dry for me that is not my favorite but for my spouse loves it. I have to admit I like my rice soft and wet or sticky so this rice ia ok but like I said a personal preference.   Drinks: Thai ice tea rocks water at table before we even sat down from getting food off the buffett.  Coke and teas available but didn't get one.   For this level of food for 2 people 21.98,drinks 5.18 and tax 2.34 =29.50 is a great price.   Will be back for sure even if its not for the buffett cause the flavor is that good.

P-qW-o-TkJTu1vn2iUXdeA.text: I think the guy who is was filling my glass was named Jonathan?  Young kid. He did an amazing job!  I would come back just because he was so great and made us laugh.   Great customer service!  Also the kitchen made my curry 5.5 spicy.  It was awesome.

3pIsd7CQPDs6HP1juBwinQ.text: My stomach is very happy right now. Love the coconut chicken soup included in the buffet!  Also I'd like to mention that the tap water taste amazing.  I normally hate restaurant water but it actually tasted like high end bottled water.

7DVGnPbwmfsC79yXn7qtog.text: Review on the buffet. Food is decent. Spicy dishes not overly spicy but oily. Dishes are flavorful. About 6 different curries to try. Not much stuff inside the curry. They had some steamed veggies that I just added to my curry. Also, they didn't refill their stuff often. So there was supposed to be a fish dish, but they refilled the eggs rolls and the fried wonton like twice instead. So you can see what they want you to stuff yourself up with first.    The flavor of the pad see ew was good, but I just didn't like the overly oilyness. Also, the fried rice was not good. Just hard. The pad thai is okay.   No sweet desserts...

93L8dUHs8c1cI5ciigknng.text: Best THAI in PHX we've found by far. When you ask for spicy - you get spicy. Portions are generous and well executed. The yellow and red curries are out of this world. Great menu with plenty of choices. Very cozy atmosphere and take-out is a breeze. Staff is always warm and friendly. There are a lot of Thai places in Phoenix to consider but not many who can hit the authenticity and overall value Reign of Thai can. Highly recommended.

hmFEJboSkQPe1ppgugQGdQ.text: My fiance and I stopped in for a bite to eat during lunch hours on Sunday to try the buffet. To be honest I expected the buffet to be a little bigger than 2 carts in the corner of the room. The food was good I really enjoyed the garlic chicken.

c41jDwT0OAyBSygcwOUJ7A.text: Was in the Scottsdale area for a few days and wanted some authentic Thai food. I grew up in Bangkok Thailand so I am very picky and I demand real Thai food. This place is the best of the best. I usually ask for the chef and make sure they are from Thailand. Sama "Owner/Chef" came out because we spoke a little Thai and asked for a special Thai dish. Unfortunately this dish need a lot of time preparing but after speaking with her we are convinced this will be real authentic Thai. Ordered a few dishes and let me tell you. It's perfect Thai. Everything we ordered was made exactly as you would have it in Bangkok.   Too bad I live in Philadelphia or I would be there every week.

VMOwo0DoUPjdm4geohNOXg.text: This is the best Thai Buffett in town!, great choices,  great people, great atmosphere! And great food! We will come once a month.

nANhbpZOyF7Pqm2cTQOyMw.text: We went for the lunch buffet that they have Tues - Friday for $9.99/person, $2.50 for drinks. There's also a beer and wine bar.   The food was delicious with a simple yet sufficient menu choices. There were 4 different kinds of curry (the yellow curry was the best in my opinion), 2 kinds of noodle dishes and a few vegetarian options as well (eggplant and tofu was really good). The service was friendly and fast and the price was extremely reasonable. We would definitely come back here in the future.

LV-Em6gFBroVfJekWnT02Q.text: Awesome service and the Pad See Ew is the best that I've tasted in the area. The prices are fordable and they have a buffet but I've never actually tried that. A great locally-owned spot with delicious food. Very clean

jxP3Os13SLne9vhdkrBKRw.text: Best Thai food in the valley. Been here 2-3 times and every time the food quality is amazing. Highly recommended.

sdH_sYtRe2Qh5WTrRhbNCA.text: I've been here at least 8 times and each time the food is the BOMB!!! Cashew or Garlic Chicken, but never hotter than a 3!! Great service too!!

EErbx-uvDJuVnNWIuL3Q6g.text: Yummy! Went here for the first time about a week ago. Ordered the Tom Kha soup, delicious, and the pad thai which was also very good.  We also had the papaya salad which was very yummy.  If i could make one suggestion however it would be that i wished their to go containers were not styrofoam. I am considered somewhat of a "tree hugger" haha so I always like to see companies who avoid plastics  (this means straws too! Those things are terrible and not necessary) and styrofoam. But as far as the food is concerned, it was fantastic!

7SdDDkG7BAfKoWYveQArRw.text: Very good food. Good Asian food is hard to find in the Valley. Our neighbor recommended this place and it was everything she promised and more. Best soup I have ever had. Can't wait to go back.

O9EIPVo-Waz51_UMHRSLZw.text: I love this place. I always get the pineapple fried rice and have never been disappointed. It's run by a family and some friends and they have always been friendly. I make sure to stop by multiple times whenever I'm in town from college!

KSCg1QuKVv5ynD_QASc8nA.text: Nice place with delicious food and most importantly the staff were very nice, helpful and did their best to accommodate our lil 2 yr old. Thank you very much!

bS5uoTLjUeGlcdvbq7_fNg.text: Hole in the wall kind of place with the most delicious lunch buffet I can remember eating. I hate lukewarm buffets, I hate buffets in general, but this one is definitely an exception. The assortment, taste, and price make this one of my favorite little Thai places. The spicy basil chicken and the panang curry were a few of my favs. Highly recommend this little gem of a spot!

c-VOsTqOCAzWGb3QL6lcBg.text: Ok we've been back like at least once a month and tried so many dishes. The panang curry continues to be a favorite along with eggplant and the cashew nut. Pad Thai comes loaded with veggies and is always a solid choice.  We've brought different people in and recommended this place to many. Everyone has agreed this is the best Thai place they've tried in AZ.   The service is always great and we end up always having a great time.   This is a must of you're looking for bomb Thai food and especially if you're vegetarian, they do an excellent job making dishes vegetarian while still full of the best flavor.

n--g53SbvYO4dIoGXSf6UQ.text: Appearances can be deceiving. Doesn't look like much on the outside, but once you go inside, you're welcomed to a stunning culinary experience. Mom and I were amazed by the mosaic of flavorful dishes the buffet provided. In addition to there being a thai food BUFFET. How often do you find those?  We love thai food and we weren't the least bit disappointed. The staff members were attentive to our tables and to other tables. There was a mad rush of customers as soon as it opened-with very good reason. You have to wait for the food to be replenished but HEY it's a buffet and it's well worth the wait. And what can you expect, with hordes of patrons waiting for a single dish?  Fantastic place.

hOd-pwc8JHEmz2skF_8tLw.text: Can't wait to come back. Buffet: 1130-2 weekdays not sure about buffet weekends; $12 a head, spices available to supplement. Soups, Curry's, rice, noodles, fried rice, veggies   First Thai buffet I've seen anywhere. Really enjoyed everything about this place. It's next to a tire shop and looks like a hole in the wall. Then you walk into a blossoming room with great interior colors and atmosphere. Immediately you get a sense that the meal will deliver. And it does along with a friendly staff.  It's important to understand that a lunch buffet is not a gourmet meal nor a resort brunch. It's a lunch buffet and should be judged accordingly. The food is made in bulk and made to please the masses. So it can't be too spicy or intense. And I thought this place was a pleasant surprise that hit the spot and filled up a hungry couple who knows how to chow!  The variety was nice as there were about 12-14 items nice and hot. Half were curries of many varieties of meat and color which were all great. Yellow/red/green/spicy/pineapple/pork/beef/chicken. Nice variety of curry to say the least. I couldn't get enough.   Some of the meat was a bit over cooked for my liking but nothing that bothered me much or kept me from eating it. I suppose that has to be the way for folks to feel safe.   Otherwise it was awesome. The fresh food kept coming and the staff kept up nicely with replacing dishes and taking your dirty plates as well.   Thanks Reign if Thai can't wait to be back.   You won't be disappointed with this place! It's good times and the quality is good for a buffet.

XmAa-mtUv7bJe-QCdjSXKw.text: I recently went to this small Thai spot with a group of work friends for a lunch.  The restaurant is very small from the outside, and can be easily missed. Once inside, it is surprisingly more spacious than it appears before you enter.   The serving crew seems nice and the food was fresh and relatively tasty, living up to the moderate expectations of most people's hopes for a Thai food restaurant, I would guess. I enjoyed it.  That said, the restaurant was relatively slow on refilling the buffet trays of essential ingredients. Chicken, pad thai, and rice all ran out and in a restaurant that was full seemed to have everyone waiting for some food to come from the kitchen.  The pricing was average and didn't surprise me as being too much or really low.  Overall, while the people and food seemed good enough to return, I doubt I ever will make another trip here. There are just too many good food spots to go to that seem to be more aware and attentive to have the food out and fully stocked.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VXjXM8AXJ0-imQSx_Opv3w.text: We had their Pad Thai and their Egg Fried rice. Both were delicious! Pad Thai does not come with tofu but does have 2 shrimps and your choice of meat.  They are SERIOUS about SPICE! You can order 0-4 in spice and even a 0.5 is spicier than most molds. We had a spicy-lover who ordered a 4 and he couldn't handle it.

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Thai

3AtFq3Ewixh0Sy5aAzTuaQ.text: Today was our third time at Reign of Thai, which is a pretty easily missed hole in the wall on northern Cave Creek. Parking is a bit of a challenge since it shares a lot with an auto repair store but we've never been unable to find parking. The restaurant feels much larger inside than it does when looking from the outside, its got a homie cabin feel with wood panelled walls and exposed rafter ceiling. Though a portion of the room is dedicated to their buffet (which is offered until they close for lunch Monday thru Friday and on Sundays for 11.99!)  My boyfriend grew up eating his grandmother's amazing Thai food, so he's incredibly picky but this place exceeded his expectations. And I definitely mean that they exceed, the first two times we came he ordered a 5 spice level and it was defibitely Thai hot. I've ordered their 4 and 3 but will admit that today I had to sink to lowly 2 spice level but finally found what was just right for me.   I ordered the Fresh Ginger chicken and found it perfect, the ginger had a great taste and the broth was delicious and not too sweet. My boyfriend got the panang curry with beef and added bamboo, he recieved a troph size dish of steaming spicy goodness. I tried a bite and found my whole mouth on tasty fire. After that I dipped bits of my order into his curry and thought it was amazing, in the end I added just a spoonful of the curry to my plate and enjoyed the light fresh sweetness of my dish with the robust spiciness of his. Fantastic!   We also ordered an appetizer of egg rolls that weren't anything special, though their dipping sauce was some of the best I've ever tried. I'd buy a bottle of that for toast haha.  I love that this place is clearly family run, the waiters were brothers and clearly knowledgable about each dish. They even ensure customers know that when they say spicy, they aren't kidding around! Definitely a great place to bring anyone who loves a good spicy meal, or given its location, its a fantastic place to have lunch after hitting up the localy antique stores or enjoying a Sunday drive down Cave Creek.  We will definitely be back, and next time I'm coming for that buffet

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WD9D8_uOm3-LFLM2FcAhVw.text: Very flavorful food! Their spice level is almost 2 higher than normal. I ordered a 2 spice level and it tasted like a 4. I ordered the drunken noodles with tofu, drunken noodles with beef and yellow curry. It was all delicious. There was only one waitress and she took good care of us considering it was getting busy for lunch.  I've never known a Thai restaurant to have a buffet...this one does! It seems quite popular too. Everyone was coming in for that.

4NkV-TuCyzLG_XlqtbK2UQ.text: Food & service were excellent! The reason for four stars was just the outdated interior, super loud rumbling noise in the dining area (continuous like a generator was on top of us), and cleanliness.   5 starts for vegetarian pad Thai, chicken spring rolls, and yellow chicken curry. All were flavored as a "1 star" as their scale of spiciness is 0-2, unlike the menu suggests (1-5).   Location had a handful of parking spots so I imagine if the dining room were full it would be a more full lot.   Lastly, we came for the buffet but were misinformed about when it would be available. Definitely will be back for the buffet and will gladly update my review!

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YexPLxD3P15kspO96VOWBA.text: We come here A LOT! Teriyaki chicken with fried rice level 2 is perfect! The eggplant is really good as well and the curry.

dj_V4lMAJF6HWPg_K0OJZg.text: Given its location and appearance, we weren't expecting much, but were pleasantly surprised to find the best Thai food in the Phoenix area! Everything was delicious. We had the Thai Egg Rolls, Pad-See-Yew with beef, and Red Curry with chicken. Even the rice was delicious. Originally we were going to do a level 3 heat, but went with level 2 instead, which offered plenty of spice. The portions are generous and the prices are reasonable for all you receive.   All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. I'd highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for amazing Thai food. We will definitely be going back to try some of the other items on their menu.

EXozr8b_4oLDKdERkYypgA.text: Do not let the outside appearance prevent you from coming inside. This place is on a strange corner next to an auto repair place. Inside, clean, comfy, charming. Everyone friendly, and efficient. So you help yourself to the lunch buffet. Start with the soups, and grab a couple of fried won tons. The most delicious, perfectly spiced authentic Thai soups I've had since Nakhon Sawhon province,1973!!! Filled up a plate with a nice crisp egg roll, fried rice, noodles, and a beef curry. All were delicious. Next plate, tried the white rice, and a bit of each curry dish.  At least 8 different dishes. Everything was tasty, fresh and full of Thai flavor. We drove from Chandler, just to try this place due to Yelp reviews. Good decision. Place got full for lunch, but comfortable and welcoming atmosphere. Best Thai food in Phoenix area, imho.

MzCqzLHQT6ZbbvXgmjON8w.text: Wow!! What an amazing Surprise!! My daughter found this gem on Yelp when our other Thai place was closed! Now this will be our Favorite!! We went during the buffet- which was Outstanding!! Great soups. Curry goodies and lots of delicious sides! We all commented on the Amazing Find we stumbled on to and vowed that we would be coming back again for sure!!

jFRC_7Fah8MrENwlOIZDvA.text: Came to Reign of Thai for Sunday lunch with the family and FINALLY made it for their buffet! I'll be honest, I'm always very skeptical of buffets but THIS buffet is one you have to try! They provide a selection with zero spice and have a line of spice jars if you want to kick it up a notch.  We tried just about everything they had and was not disappointed with a single one! They had curry, fried and jasmin rice, noodles, soups, wontons, egg rolls...YES PLEASE! we will be back for the buffet and if we happen to miss it, we will of course stay for a menu item!

photos.caption: Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h2cnb8r2xoYmgOZiV8K4qQ.text: Reign of Thai is my absolute favourite thai place in the valley.   The food is amazing, but I am obsessed with the Drunken Noodle with tofu and don't often order anything other than this.   The staff can be incredibly friendly, and also standoffish. It depends on who's serving you. There are some people we love there, and others who make you feel less welcomed.   Tips to know when visiting -  Most of the sauces are made with fish sauce, including for vegetarian dishes. Just let your server know you are vegan, and they have other options. :-) Please don't be rude to them, though. It is common to name fish sauce as a vegetarian option in thai restaurants. I advise the people who gave such poor reviews for this to educate themselves on the food culture and be aware of different practices before getting upset that it's not convenient for them.   Lastly, the spice levels vary, and if you're a wimp like me go for level one!

_iAi3_H9BXVY19T1p-q1oA.text: WARNING *****DO NOT EAT HERE! On 9/3/19 I placed a to go order at lunch around 1:47 pm for an order of spicy fried rice, spicy basil, spicy green beans with chicken and coconut soup with chicken, and one thai iced. Also side note the restaurant was completely empty. There was no lunch rush. Almost all the servers were sitting down and chatting except for the one that helped me at the cashier. My family and I have eaten at this restaurant several times in the past but this experience has been the most disturbing and disgusting thing we've had seen personally. My brother had the coconut soup with chicken and decided to eat his soup later in the evening. The container wasn't opened until then so the lid was never opened. My brother realized after taken a few bites/sips of soup that there was a cockroach in the broth of the soup. He found 2! It was already too late to call the restaurant last night but we will be contacting them today and the food department to make sure someone does a proper health inspection before they end up getting people extremely sick/killed. I never like giving restaurants bad reviews [1 star] but this is disgusting. Please don't eat here and if you do, check your food completely before consumption.

Photo of Reign Of Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cockroaches in coconut soup!!

rKT4MtqjRNbvhvf1nKdHyA.text: The service here is excellent!!  As soon as we walked in, we were greeted and were seated right away!  Our water was always filled! The waiter kept checking on us to see if there's anything else that we needed. Such a down to earth guy.  The food was so good!!! I love this Thai food joint. Don't let the location and the look of the restaurant outside fool you! Portion size is very generous!  It didn't take long til the food came out. If you like heat... I recommend getting a 2 for the spicy level! But if you don't, like myself, then get level 1! It's still very spicy! Of course you can add more chili later! Here are something's I ordered. I also order other things but we were too hungry before I devoured it! The love the presentation and the plates they use serve the food!   It has a family feel and most authentic Thai place I've been to!   Must try (:

9FErMQTbfsgpDDhIkTA33w.text: So many flavors on the lunch buffet. I love curries but have never had so many side by side.  Each one tasted so different from the others.  The noodle dishes were a little limp but that happens when they sit for even just a few minutes.  The servers were very kind despite my wimpy spice tolerance and kept my water glass full. I look forward to going back soon!

Kf4w7ruz_8kIv72OscWVVw.text: So happy my friends told me about this place. It is hard to find, but SOOOO worth it. They aren't bashful with their peppers, so start mild and work your way up.

P1Z4viGcfY72NGvGCF8vZg.text: First thing I noticed at Reign of Thai was a notice posted on each table. It's asking for patience while your meals are being prepared. This tells me that they are either understaffed or really popular. Either case, you have been forewarned so can't complain later.   We decided to order pad Thai, beef/vegetable garlic sauce and chicken yellow curry with choice of 1 to 5 spice levels in each of the dishes. 1 is not mild. The waitress recommend 0.5 if we wanted mild and she was right. 0.5 was still bit spicy. Level 3 on our curry dish was very spicy.   We started off with lemon grass chicken soup. This was really good and the lemon grass gave good flavor in the broth. I noticed as the soup cooled, the saltier the broth became.   The beef and vegetables with garlic sauce was really good. I just wished it was less sweet and more garlicky.  Other than that, the ingredients were fresh, beef was tender, and good flavor.  The best part of the chicken curry was the potatoes. It was really tasty and the portion was huge; enough for leftovers.  Th pad Thai was really good too. Next time, I would spice down because 3 was really spicy.   Overall very nice meal. Just remember to go when you are not in a hurry. Or opt for their lunch buffet which I'm looking forward to trying.

atkSRLe47hJnQ3yPpyCUEw.text: We love this place,  food is always delicious.  Staff is very friendly.  Their Thai iced tea is the best I've had. You can tell they put their heart in their creations.

U0Wa4PsbnxMoKBbrl_7JMQ.text: Genuinely the best Thai I have had in Phoenix. The spice is intense - which the waitress warned us about - and the food was perfectly cooked. I highly recommend this place. Especially the pa-naeng curry!

Z2Sk6U46cHtJd2KX0iKFjQ.text: This place has an amazing buffet.  It's too bad they didn't post on their website that they're closed until 7/10/18.  Others showed up at around the same time we did and were disappointed to find out they were closed. Please don't make people drive just to find out your closed.

o1FqLcOg3edWM4YtxLY4sw.text: Wasn't sure about the scoville temp, so we order the yummy coconut soup at spice level 3 to gauge our dinner.  wonderful soup, a must try. 3 was pretty spicy.  Most of our party ordered their dinner from 1 to 3. I on the otherhand ordered at level 4.  The wait staff was very helpful. Really enjoyed our visit. We'll be back to try the special steak treat, recommended by the chef.  Keep up the good work!

o85rHs_T8Izo7Ao2WiGPQA.text: Pro: good service , authentic Thai food, curry heaven Cons: lunch buffet empty out fast, they can't keep up as they cook in small batches  Kids love the calamari and chicken satay
